image.altText: A close up shot of a brown and tan dachshund / sausage dog, with big eyes looking directly into camera.

props.synopsis:
A dachshund was rescued from a rabbit hole over the weekend in the Central Australian town of Yulara.

The rescue effort, which took six hours, rallied the community, with a local plumber and NT Fire and Rescue Service members providing vital help.

Alice's minders say she has recovered and seems undeterred from chasing rabbits.

title.children: Locals rally to save dachshund stuck down rabbit hole in six-hour mission

image.altText: Dheran Young, Acting Police Commissioner Martyn Doyle and Acting Chief Minister Gerard Maley lay wreaths

props.synopsis: Three police officers shot dead in the line of duty this year are being honoured as part of National Police Remembrance Day services around Australia.

title.children: Acting Police Commissioner says officer's death 'impacted the whole community'

image.altText: A close-up of the directions on a small bottle of pepper spray.

props.synopsis: Security guards at a Darwin nightclub have been confronted with pepper spray two weekends in a row, during the first month of a Northern Territory-wide trial of the weapons.

title.children: Union labels pepper spray trial 'dangerous' after two incidents in two weeks

image.altText: A young girl jumping on a mattress on a red dirt ground.

props.synopsis: Many Aboriginal people in Tennant Creek live in overcrowded makeshift shelters with no running water or electricity, as they wait up to a decade for a home. But experts say the social housing being built is not safe for the climate of today, let alone into the future.

title.children: These Australians are homeless with a house

image.altText: a pink pub with a sign saying 'larrimah hotel'

props.synopsis: The Larrimah Hotel is sold again, after capturing the world's attention in podcasts and films about the disappearance 70-year-old Paddy Moriarty.

title.children: Owner sells outback pub shrouded in mystery after 70yo's disappearance

image.altText: A woman and elderly man sitting at a table with serious expressions.

props.synopsis: A class action on behalf of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people alleges a Commonwealth Work for the Dole scheme was tougher on remote participants than on jobseekers in cities.

title.children: Class action against Work for the Dole alleges racial discrimination

image.altText: A man stands between two ceremonial poles

props.synopsis: The family of vanished Yolŋu leader Dhakiyarr Wirrpanda is calling on the Northern Territory coroner to pursue an ABC investigation's lead on his mysterious disappearance.

title.children: Vanished Aboriginal leader's family call for probe into alleged killer

image.altText: A photo of a street poster of Ayatollah Khomeini.

props.synopsis: For 12 days in June, the world watched as Iran and Israel traded blows. What came next was a brutal purge of spies and traitors.

title.children: Iran was stunned by Israel's spy infiltration. Now it's exacting its revenge

image.altText: A beam of light extends from a lens atop a canvas canopy.

props.synopsis: A Canberra-made laser is about to become NATO's newest frontline defence against enemy drones, in a deal experts say could transform the future of warfare.

title.children: Australian-made Star Wars-style lasers are helping NATO tackle drone threats

image.altText: A man giving a speech at a lecturn. He wears a row of service medals on his jacket.

props.synopsis: Serious allegations of conflict of interest and a secret plan to strip sub-branches of their assets have been made about RSL New South Wales.

title.children: Secret plans and alleged conflicts of interests at top of RSL NSW exposed

image.altText: Two men in cowboy costumes embrace and pose for the camera.

props.synopsis: Mitch Brown, the first AFL player to reveal he is bisexual, hits out at Bailey Smith and Patrick Dangerfield over a social media post from Mad Monday.

title.children: 'Makes you a loser': Brown hits out at Cats players over Mad Monday post

image.altText: A nurse writes out a script.

props.synopsis: Qualified registered nurses will soon be able to write prescriptions for medications, in a bid to ease pressure on a stressed public healthcare system.

title.children: Can't get a GP appointment? A nurse could soon prescribe for you

image.altText: A five-year-old girl of South Asian background with pig tails pointing to a card held by a preschool educator.

props.synopsis: Despite the government wanting its Thriving Kids program for children with "mild to moderate" developmental delay and autism to start next year, the system is yet to be designed.

title.children: How will the NDIS alternative for some autistic kids work?

image.altText: A man looks at the YouTube website on a computer screen.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump sued parent company Alphabet and other social media companies after the platforms suspended his accounts in 2021.

title.children: YouTube to pay Trump $33.46m following Jan 6 Capitol riots ban

image.altText: Optus graphic

props.synopsis: Analysts say the Optus CEO should "leave quietly" now or risk a more public exit once the reviews into the company's recent outages are complete.

title.children: The Optus triple-0 crisis has moved up a gear and all eyes are on one executive

image.altText: A submarine sailing through the water, with an American flag flying from the top.

props.synopsis: The agency responsible for delivering AUKUS has spent five times what it first planned for consultants to review its operations.

title.children: Submarine agency's consultancy bill five times larger than planned

image.altText: A Taliban flag being held by two men.

props.synopsis: Taliban authorities in Afghanistan have imposed a nationwide shutdown of communications, weeks after they began severing fibre optic connections.

title.children: Taliban imposes communication shutdown in Afghanistan to prevent 'vice'

image.altText: CCTV shows a car being set a light on a back street

props.synopsis: Police have released footage showing the moment a gunman fired on a suburban Sydney home in July, with investigations into the matter continuing.

title.children: Video shows drive-by shooting on Sydney home linked to drug dealers

image.altText: Six people in dark blue suits and helmets holding guns stand on the street.

props.synopsis: Youth-led protests over water and power cuts in Madagascar lasted three days and were the largest the island had seen in years.

title.children: Madagascan government dissolved after deadly protests killed 22 people

image.altText: A group of workers in high-vis walking across scaffolding at a gas plant.

props.synopsis: The federal environment minister was advised pollution from Woodside's Karratha Gas Plant may be causing irreversible changes to ancient rock art, before granting the company a 40-year extension with strict conditions.

title.children: Minister knew of rock art threat before approving Woodside gas plant extension

image.altText: Close up of Charlotte robot the World-First Robot for Lunar and Earth Construction

props.synopsis: Developers of a speedy, "spider-like" robot named Charlotte believe it could be building homes on Earth within years, and eventually further lunar exploration.

title.children: Robot that works at 'speed of 100 bricklayers' could soon be building homes

image.altText: A teenage boy being held by police officers on each arm being led to a divvy van.

props.synopsis: Police have charged two 16 and 17-year-old boys in relation to a dangerous incident involving an allegedly stolen car being driven into the pedestrian-only Bourke Street Mall.

title.children: Boys charged over brazen Bourke Street Mall incident

image.altText: A  man wearing a cap and a grey hoodie marked R4W looks into camera with a serious facial expression.

props.synopsis: The grand final-bound Origin prop and at least three other NRL players are promoting a clothing brand linked to the Alameddine crime family, fuelling police concern the league has failed to stem the influence of organised crime.

title.children: Bronco fronts crime-linked activewear brand

image.altText: Mike Kaiser

props.synopsis: New figures released in the department's annual report reveal Mike Kaiser was paid "termination benefits" of $397,000 in the last financial year.

title.children: Queensland bureaucrats paid hundreds of thousands in 'termination benefits'

image.altText: A pile of junk food and snacks

props.synopsis: UNICEF says more children are now overweight and under-nourished than too thin, stirring fresh calls by health experts and farming bodies to tax ultra-processed food producers.

title.children: Finding of more obese yet malnourished kids reignites junk food debate

image.altText: Close up of a stick of salami being sliced on a chopping board.

props.synopsis: Producers and retailers say there are more ways to cook goat than just in curry, but so far consumers have shown little interest.

title.children: Australia is the world's biggest goat exporter — so why don't we eat it?

image.altText: a composite of a watermelon, red apples and string beans

props.synopsis: The cost-of-living crisis means fresh produce is more expensive for all Australians, but residents in some remote WA towns are paying up to triple for some items compared to city prices.

title.children: Remote WA residents pay $18 for a watermelon quarter

image.altText: A female pensioner holding her open purse in her hands.

props.synopsis: Women's super balances are disproportionately impacted by events later in life, in addition to childcare duties, which could mean serious financial problems, research from Super Members Council (SMC) has found.

title.children: Older Australian women could retire in poverty, new report says

image.altText: The EA Sports logo on a phone screen, with gaming title cover art seen in the background.

props.synopsis: A consortium of private equity companies, including one backed by Donald Trump's son-in-law, Jared Kushner, is offering to take the video game giant private.

title.children: The Sims maker Electronic Arts bought for $80bn in record private equity buyout

image.altText: Rick Morton, a man in his late 30s with stubble, smiles slightly, wearing a blazer and wire-framed glasses.

props.synopsis: Journalist Rick Morton didn't want to write a book about Robodebt. Now that book, Mean Streak, has won the Prime Minister's Literary Award for non-fiction.

title.children: A book on Robodebt won a literary award, but shattered the author's naivety

image.altText: A roast chicken on a plate with chips, salad and glasses of iced water.

props.synopsis: It is the most consumed protein in the country, but an independent review of Australia's chicken meat industry has found the market is failing, threatening supply and prices.

title.children: Review finds chicken meat market 'more concentrated than the supermarkets'

image.altText: A close up of an insect with six legs and a hard shelled oval shaped body on sand.

props.synopsis: Often mistaken for a stink bug or Christmas beetle, this iridescent insect has descended on Geraldton with a tear gas-like odour.

title.children: Green carab beetle stinks up Geraldton to escape spring heat

image.altText: GettyImages-2237841270

props.synopsis: After suffering a heartbreaking loss in the 2023 NRL grand final, Jordan Riki says redemption is fuelling Brisbane's journey to the 2025 title.

title.children: Broncos star says pain of 2023 has his team on a redemption mission

image.altText: A woman in a yellow-and-black striped jersey, holding a yellow football, is tackled from behind.

props.synopsis: Top-four aspirants Hawthorn are set to lose Emily Bates for the run towards the finals after the star midfielder suffered a shoulder injury.

title.children: Hawks lose captain ahead of run to AFLW finals

image.altText: Will Skelton running the ball for the Wallabies, with a defending crouching to make a tackle

props.synopsis: Lock Will Skelton is set to return for the Wallabies ahead of the final round of the Rugby Championship against the All Blacks.

title.children: Skelton returns after logistics chaos kept him from first Bledisloe Test
